messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Uh, 5001, there's a man with a gun.
5001, what street, sir?
Uh, Camden Road.
What's the phone number you're calling me from?
Huh?
What's the phone number you're calling me from?
Uh...
You said there's a man with a gun? Where is he at?
He's sitting on the porch.
What does he look like, sir? Black, white, Asian, or Hispanic?
White, gray beard.
Gray beard?
Yeah.
What color shirt?
He's wearing a white shirt with blue stripes.
And he's just sitting there with it?
Yeah, he's just sitting there with it, but he has threatened.
He threatened who?
The neighbors. They were outside.
Okay, we have officers on the way. If anything changes, please call us right back.
Okay, thank you.
You're welcome. Bye-bye.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
5001 Camden Road.
Repeat the address for verification.
5001 Camden Road.
Okay, and what's the phone number you are calling from?
It's, uh, geez, it's my cell phone. I don't even know my own cell phone number.
Is it?
Yeah, that's it.
What's your name?
Susan Brandon.
Okay, Susan, tell me exactly what happened.
My ex-husband is sitting outside, and I think he just called 911. He's got a pellet gun, and I think he's saying...
Did you already call us?

My ex-husband is calling you right now. I just wanted to let you know that he doesn't have a real gun. He's calling to say that somebody has a gun outside. He's drunk, and I think he wants to be taken away.
What's your ex-husband's name?
Ronald Brandon. He's been staying with me, and he's drunk.
And he said that someone else had a gun?
Yes, and it's him. I think.
Does he have a gun?
No, he has a pellet gun.
Is it loaded?
No, I don't think so. I'm pretty sure there are no pellets in it.
Okay. Why did your husband call us?
I think he wants to end his drunkenness. You know what I mean?
Oh God, here the sirens are coming. Jesus Christ. It's not a real gun. I think he wants to be taken away.
Okay. So Susan, you did not call us earlier, right?
No, I did not.
Okay. What race is your husband?
He's white.
Describe him.
He's got a beard. He's 48 years old. He's wearing a striped shirt and jean shorts.
Striped shirt and shorts. Susan, what's going on?
Oh my God.
What's going on, Susan?
They shot him.
They shot your husband?
Oh God.
I think we have shots fired on Camden.
Okay, stay calm. Is your husband shot?
Yes, he's shot.
Okay, stay on the phone with me, okay? Stay in the house.
Oh God.
Stay in the house.
Yes.
I'm on with 911.
Listen, ma'am, we have help on the way, okay? Stay inside the house, Susan.
Oh God, thank you. They shot him. There's nobody else around.
Okay, regardless of what kind of gun he had, he must have brandished it at the officers, okay?
I was calling to tell you it's a pellet gun.
Oh God.
Oh Jesus.
Can you see your husband now?
He's lying there with blood on him.
From his head?
Yes, I think it's from his head.
Susan, who's yelling?
The officer is yelling. I'm on with 911, okay?
Are the officers asking you to come out?
He's just telling me to move.
Do not move. Tell them it's a pellet gun.
I called 911 to say it's a pellet gun, okay?
Who are you talking to, Susan?
I'm talking to the officer who's aiming a rifle at me.
Oh God, I can't believe this is happening.
I called 911 to tell them it was a pellet gun. I can't believe they shot him.
I can't believe it.
Do you want me to hang up or stay on the phone with you, Susan?
No, you don't have to.
Okay. I'll let you talk to the officers.
All right, bye.
